content.description: The Sharpsicle Boulder is an overhanging prow tucked away in a small alcove. It has a few excellent lines on sharp holds with big fun moves.
content.protection: One or two pads for a pretty good landing zone. FYI everyone that visits the park should be aware of some broken glass due to the years of neglect and partying.
content.location: Sharpsicle starts sitting deep under the overhang on the right side. With your feet on a good ledge put your right hand on a block near the arete and your left on a little grey pudding stone. pull up and move left hand way out left to a sharp ass crimp and work your right hand up a variety of good holds on the right arete to gain the top out (CRACK IS OFF)

content.description: Sit start at the right end of the Blackfish Traverse, the other boulder is on for feet. Pull on to the rock and top out as for the finish of Blackfish Traverse, but easier due to the huge feet.Â
content.location: Orca Boulder-- a low long boulder to the right of Sharpsicle

content.description: It's basically the opposite sit start for Sharpsicle. Sit down at left arete deep under the overhang. climb up and right moving into the crimps in the center part of the wall from there dyno to the lip.
Stand Start on the flake on the left as you enter the area
content.location: Stat with hands on the flake, feet on the adjoining boulder.

content.description: This climb reminds me of the problem "Around the corner" at Lincoln Woods ,but much lower. Take a seat under where the Boulder splits at the left arete. Match hands on a small ledge and heel hook with right foot. pull up and move right about 6 feet  following the crack staying low until you can reach a obvious sidepull then top out. Very fun moves for a lowball !!
content.location: This problem sits just left of Sharpsicle on the adjacent Boulder.

content.description: Traverse the Orca boulder left to right, using only the obvious ledge, not the pedestal boulder underneath. Heel hook city!   The crux is switching the heel hook about three quarters of the way through.   Super fun route that can be worked without much need of spotters if pad placement is right.
content.protection: boulder pad-- one and a spotter or two.
content.location: Orca boulder, to the right of the Sharpsicle. Follow the ledge to jug and then pebble top-out.

content.description: This Boulder is an overhanging prow that has been over looked for a while. It has a few excellent climbs on sharp holds with big moves.
